justification: The reduction of GHG emissions can lead to increased food production and reduced losses, making food more affordable and accessible.
The implementation of GHG reduction targets may require significant changes in agricultural practices, potentially constraining the competitiveness of the agricultural sector.
Improving the energy efficiency of buildings can reinforce the quality of food storage and handling, leading to healthier food options.
The transition to low-carbon transportation may increase costs for food transportation, counteracting efforts to make food more affordable.
The removal of GHG emissions from the atmosphere is closely linked to the reduction of pesticides, as both targets aim to mitigate the environmental impact of human activities.
The reduction of GHG emissions can create new job opportunities in the green economy, enabling better social security and worker protection.
